channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani Is Hurt in Car Crash in New Hampshire
item.description: Mr. Giuliani, the former New York City mayor and lawyer for President Trump, suffered a fractured vertebra, his head of security said.

item.title: Trump Crime Strategy May Work for Now, but Not for Long, Experts Say
item.description: The president is looking to add troops to city streets while cutting funds for programs that work, experts and local officials say. But one idea, beau...

item.title: Robert Mueller Has Parkinson’s Disease, Family Says
item.description: The former special counsel, who led the Russia investigation during President Trump’s first term, has had difficulty speaking in recent months. A cong...

item.title: Asia is ahead of the curve of using AI to fight fraud. Here’s what the rest of the world can learn from it
item.description: As Asia’s crime syndicates make headlines, Asian banks are quietly leading a shift in how to prevent fraud.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani suffers fractured vertebra in car crash after being ‘flagged down’ by domestic violence victim
item.description: His vehicle was hit shortly after pulling onto the highway in a crash that was “entirely unrelated” to the domestic violence incident, Giuliani’s head...

item.title: US trading partners ‘dazed and confused’ after tariff court loss
item.description: The judges suggested that any injunction could potentially be narrowed to apply only to those who sued.

item.title: Already Pardoned by Trump, Jan. 6 Rioters Push for Compensation
item.description: One of the rioters’ lawyers wants to create a panel that would decide on financial damages for what the rioters believe were unfair prosecutions.

item.title: U.S. Suspends Visas for Palestinian Passport Holders, Officials Say
item.description: The move will stop, at least temporarily, travel for medical treatment, attending university, visiting relatives or conducting business.

item.title: Behind Thai Premier’s Dismissal, Unraveling of an Uneasy Alliance
item.description: Thaksin Shinawatra had struck a grand bargain with Thailand’s establishment, analysts say, that allowed his daughter to ascend to the prime minister’s...

item.title: Brazil Tightens Bolsonaro House Arrest Amid Escape Concerns
item.description: Former President Jair Bolsonaro, who will stand trial on Tuesday, is being closely monitored by the Brazilian authorities, who fear he may try to flee...

item.title: U.S. Suspends Visas for Palestinian Passport Holders, Officials Say
item.description: The move will stop, at least temporarily, travel for medical treatment, attending university, visiting relatives or conducting business.

item.title: Colleges should go ‘medieval’ on students to beat AI cheating, NYU official says
item.description: "Now that most mental effort tied to writing is optional, we need new ways to require the work necessary for learning."

item.title: The Fed’s independence is hanging by a thread, and this ‘nuclear’ scenario would signal ‘things are truly going off the rails,’ economists say
item.description: “The particular case of Governor Cook is not as important as what this latest move shows about the escalation in the assaults on the Fed.”

item.title: Judge Halts U.S. Effort to Deport Guatemalan Children as Planes Sit on Tarmac
item.description: The temporary block ended another last-minute flurry of legal action over the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown.

item.title: China Shows Off Its Power
item.description: Xi Jinping is using a summit with leaders like Narendra Modi and Vladimir Putin as an opportunity to pull countries away from the U.S.
